intro: Leptochloa digitata, commonly known as the digitate grass, is a flowering plant species belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences with florets that are typically pale green to brown in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. Leptochloa digitata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
